testcase.name: (D)Ad-WiFi-Client-Iso(RC)WiFi_AP(RE)(Select Venues) Enable isolation in AP
testcase.preconditions:
1. Venues created (name: Venue1, Venue2)
2. User be assigned
    Advanced Permissions> WiFi > Network Control (Policies) > Client Isolation (RC),
    Advanced Permissions> WiFi > WiFi >Access Point (RE),
    User can access Venue1.
3. Created WLAN e.g."_WLAN",active WLAN in Venue1, Venue2
4. AP1 in Venue1,AP2 in Venue2
5. UE1 connect to AP1 MAC address e.g. "00:11:22:33:44:01" UE2 connect to AP2 MAC address e.g. "00:11:22:33:44:02". 
6. Created Client_Isolation profile.
 
Policy Name: e.g. "isolation_001"
Select client 
MAC address, e.g. "00:11:22:33:44:01" from Venue1
MAC address, e.g. "00:11:22:33:44:02" from Venue2

step.actions: Login ACX with account
step.expectedresults: Login success

step.actions:
1. Go to WiFi> Access Point.
    Edit AP e.g. "AP1",
 
In Networking tab, go to LAN ports page,
Select LAN1, Click "Customize".
 
Enable Client Isolation.
In Client isolation Allowlist, Select Profile e.g. "isolation_001",
 
2.Click "Policy Details" to check policy content.
step.expectedresults:
1. Policy ""isolation_001""shall list in the dropdown list. 
 
2. Policy contemt shall be displayed correctly.

step.actions: Check "Add policy" icon
step.expectedresults: There is  "Add Policy" icon

step.actions:
Select Profile "isolation_001"  in dropdown list
Click "Apply".
step.expectedresults:
Configuration can be save correctly,
Relative log shall be logged.
Relative Activate shall be logged.

testcase.name: (D)Ad-WiFi-Client-Iso(R)WiFi_network(RC)(All Venues)During creating(Open)WLAN,Select-profile
testcase.preconditions:
1. Venues created (name: Venue1, Venue2)
2. User be assigned
    Advanced Permissions> WiFi > Network Control (Policies) > Client Isolation (R),
    Advanced Permissions> WiFi > WiFi >WiFi Network (RC),
    Advanced Permissions> Venue > WiFi (RE)
    User can access all venues.
3. AP1 in Venue1,AP2 in Venue2
4. Created Client_Isolation profile.
 
Policy Name: e.g. "isolation_001"
Client
MAC address, e.g. "00:11:22:33:44:01" 
MAC address, e.g. "00:11:22:33:44:02"

step.actions: Login ACX with account
step.expectedresults: Login success

step.actions:
1. Go to WiFi Network, create "_WLAN",

In "Show more setting" , Click "Network Control" tab,

Enable "Client Isolation", other option by default.

2. Enable "Client Isolation Allowlist by Venue"

3 Go to Venue page, Activate WLAN in Venue1, Venue2

4. Back to "Settings" page
step.expectedresults:
Venue1 and Venue2 shall list in "Client Isolation Allowlist by Venue"

Policy "isolation_001" shall list in the dropdown list.

step.actions:
Click "Next" to complete WLAN setting.
Click "Add" Eventually.
step.expectedresults:
Configuration can be save correctly,
Relative log shall be logged.
Relative Activate shall be logged.

testcase.name: (D) Adv-WiFi-Network_Control(polies)-Client_Isolation (RCE) (Select Venues)
testcase.preconditions:
1. Venue created (name: Venue1,Venue2) in US country code, e.g. address: 350 W Java Dr, Sunnyvale, CA 94089, USA. 
2. User be assigned Advanced Permissions> WiFi > Network Control (Policies) > Client Isolation (RCE)
3. A isolation profile e.g. " isolation_001" is already exist.

step.actions: Login ACX with account  e.g. User@gmail.com
step.expectedresults: Login success

step.actions: Go to Network Control, click "Client Isolation".
Check "Add Client Isolation Profile" icon.
step.expectedresults: There is "Add Client Isolation Profile" icon.

step.actions: Click  "Isolation_Profile1"
step.expectedresults: The detail of  "Isolation_Profile1" displayed

step.actions:
Go to Network Control, click "Client Isolation".
 
1. Select "Isolation_Profile1"
2. Click "Edit" 
3. Click "Add New Client"
add client "00:aa:bb:cc:dd:e3"
Click "Apply"
step.expectedresults:
1.  "Edit" shall display.
2. Go to edit page
3. MAC "00:aa:bb:cc:dd:e3" shall be able to add. and configuration shall be saved.
 
Relative Log shall be logged.
Relative Activative shall be logged.

step.actions:
1. Select "Isolation_Profile1".
2. Click "Delete"
step.expectedresults: No "Delete" icon

testcase.name: Custom-NetControl-RCED (All Venues) Network control -> Policies & Profiles - RADIUS Server
testcase.summary:
(R) - Radius server profile list

(R) - Search column

(R) - CA column

(R) - Client Certificate column

(R) - Server Certificate column

(R) - Networks drop down list

(R) - Identity Providers drop down list

(O) - Delete

(O) - Edit

(O) - Add RADIUS Server
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create 3 radius server profiles; rad-profile-1; rad-profile-2; rad-profile-3

2. Create 3 Identity Providers w/ AAA setttings; id-profile-1 (w/ rad-profile-1); id-profile-2 (w/ rad-profile-2); id-profile-3 (w/ rad-profile-3)

3. Create 3 Networks - Hotspot 2.0 network; Network-1 (w/ id-profile-1); Network-2 (w/ id-profile-2); Network-3 (id-profile-3) from the "Add" button, beside the column of Network control/Identity provider/AAA Settings/Authentication Server.
4. Create customized "Wi-Fi/Wi-Fi Networks" & "Identity provider" read & create & edit & "RADIUS read & create & edit & delete" privilege group account w/ (All Venues)

5. Create network - 802.1X w/ RADIUS server profile - rad-profile-1; Network name:  Network-4 & activated on Venue-1.

step.actions: customized read & create & edit & delete privilege group account to login Tenant.
step.expectedresults: customized read & create & edit & delete privilege group account can logged-in tenant without issue.

step.actions: Go to Network control -> Policies & Profiles - RASIUD Server profile list
step.expectedresults: RASIUD Server profile list show 3 profiles.

step.actions: Validate the upper-right hand side shows the button of "Add RADIUS Server".
step.expectedresults: The UI shows the button of "Add RADIUS Server".

step.actions: Validate there is a search column.
step.expectedresults: The page shows one search column.

step.actions: Validate the display of Networks drop down list.
step.expectedresults: The page show 3 Guest networks in the drop down list.

step.actions: Validate the display of Identity providers drop down list.
step.expectedresults: The page show 3 Identity provider profiles in the drop down list.

step.actions: Validate the display of drop down list for CA; Client Certificate; Server Certificate.
step.expectedresults: The page show 3 filter columns for CA; Client Certificate; Server Certificate.

step.actions:
1. Validate the display of pressing the button of "Add Policy or Profile".

2. Validate the Identity provider which applied the RADIUS settings.

3. Validate if the Identity provider: id-profile-1 can change the RADIUS to rad-profile-3.

4. Validate the Network-4 which applied the RADIUS settings.
step.expectedresults:
1. There is a RADIUS catalog shown.

2. The Identity profile on the stage of "AAA Settings" has the command of "Add Server".

3. The id-profile-1 can change RADIUS to rad-profile-3.

4. The Network-4/AAA settings stage; besides the column of Authentication Server has the command of "Add Server".

step.actions: Validate the upper banner shows command.

testcase.name: Access Control-R (ALL venues) NET Ctrl > Policies & Profiles > Access Control > Access Control Set
testcase.summary:
(R) - Access Control Set List

(R) - Search Column

(R) - Network dorp down list

(X) - Edit

(X) - Delete

(X) - Add Access Control Set

(X) - Access Control card in add profile page

(X) -Configure button in detail page
testcase.preconditions:
1. create 3 Venues: Venue-1; Venue-2; Venue-3

2. create 3 WLANs: WLAN-1 for Venue-1; WLAN-2 for Venue-2; WLAN-3 for Venue-3

3. There are 3 exited Access Control Set: ACS-1 for WLAN-1; ACS-2 for WLAN-2; ACS-3 for none.

4. Create user role: Custom Access Control - R w/ (ALL Venues)

step.actions:
1. Login Tenant w/ Custom Access Control - R w/ (ALL Venues) account.

2. Go to Network Control > Policies & Profiles > Access Control > Access Control Set tab

3. Check "Add Access Control Set" button

4. Select the "ACS-1" Profile

5. Check if there is a search bar

6. Check if there is a Networks drop-down list

8. Click "ACS-1" to enter detail page and check the "Configure" button.

9. Go to Administration > Admin Logs
step.expectedresults:
Step 1: Custom Access Control - R w/ (ALL Venues) can logged-in tenant without issue.

Step 2: There are 3 created Access Control Set.

Step 3: There is NO "Add Access Control Set" button

Step 4: There is NO Edit and Delete button

Step 5: There is a search bar

Step 6: There is a Networks drop-down list

Step 8: There is NO "Configure" button.

Step 9: There was 1 log about the account login, for example: "Admin rbac dog1306.dev, rbac@dog1306.dev logged into the cloud controller."

2. create 3 WLANs: WLAN-1 for Venue-1; WLAN-2 for Venue-2; WLAN-3 for Venue-3

3. There are 3 exited Access Control Set: ACS-1 for WLAN-1; ACS-2 for WLAN-2; ACS-3 for none.

4. Create user role: Custom Access Control - R+D w/ (ALL Venues)

step.actions:
1. Login Tenant w/ Custom Access Control - R+D w/ (ALL Venues) account.

2. Go to Network Control > Policies & Profiles > Access Control > Access Control Set tab

3. Check "Add Access Control Set" button

4. Select the "ACS-1" Profile

5. Delete a "ACS-3" profile

6. Check if there is a search bar

7. Check if there is a Networks drop-down list

9. Click "ACS-1" to enter detail page and check the "Configure" button.

10. Go to Administration > Admin Logs

11. Go to Administration > Activities
step.expectedresults:
Step 1: Custom Access Control - R+D w/ (ALL Venues) can logged-in tenant without issue.

Step 2: There are 3 created Access Control Set.

Step 3: There is NO "Add Access Control Set" button

Step 4: There is NO Edit button

Step 5: The user can Delete a "Access Control Set"profile

Step 6: There is a search bar

Step 7: There is a Networks drop-down list

Step 9: There is NO "Configure" button.

Step 10: There was 1 log about the account login, for example: "Admin rbac dog1306.dev, rbac@dog1306.dev logged into the cloud controller."

Step 11: There was 1 log about the account login, for example: "1 Access Control Policy Profile was deleted"

testcase.preconditions:
1. create 3 Venues: Venue-1; Venue-2; Venue-3

2. create 3 WLANs: WLAN-1 for Venue-1; WLAN-2 for Venue-2; WLAN-3 for Venue-3

3. There are 3 exited Access Control Set: ACS-1 for WLAN-1; ACS-2 for WLAN-2; ACS-3 for none.

4. Create user role: Custom Access Control - R+C+E w/ (ALL Venues)

step.actions:
1. Login Tenant w/ Custom Access Control - R+C+E w/ (All Venues) account.

2. Go to Network Control > Policies & Profiles > Access Control > Access Control Set tab

3. Check "Add Access Control Set" button

4. Select the "ACS-1" Profile

5. Create a "ACS-4" profile

6. Edit a "ACS-1" profile name to "ACS-11"

7. Check if there is a search bar

8. Check if there is a Networks drop-down list

9. Go to Network Control > Policies & Profiles > Click "Add Policy or Profile" button and check the "Access Control" card.

10. Click "ACS-1" to enter detail page and check the "Configure" button.

11. Go to Administration > Admin Logs

12. Go to Administration > Activities
step.expectedresults:
Step 1: Custom Access Control - R+C+E w/ (ALL Venues) can logged-in tenant without issue.

Step 2: There are 3 created Access Control Set.

Step 3: There is a "Add Access Control Set" button

Step 4: There is NO Delete button

Step 5: The user can Create a "Access Control Set"profile

Step 6: The user can Edit a "Access Control Set"profile

Step 7: There is a search bar

Step 8: There is a Networks drop-down list

Step 9: There is only a "Access Control" card.

Step 10: There is a "Configure" button.

Step 11: There was 1 log about the account login, for example: "Admin rbac dog1306.dev, rbac@dog1306.dev logged into the cloud controller."

Step 12: There was 2 log about the account login, for example: "Access Control Policy Profile "ACS-4" was added", "Access Control Policy Profile "ACS-11" was updated"

testcase.name: Access Control-R NET Ctrl > Policies & Profiles > Access Control(Add WLAN)(PSK)
testcase.summary:
(O) - Select from profile dorp down list

(X) - Add

(X) - Edit
testcase.preconditions:
1. create 3 Venues: Venue-1; Venue-2; Venue-3

2. There are 3 exited Access Control Set: ACS-1; ACS-2; ACS-3.

3. There are 3 exited Layer 2 profiles: Layer2-1; Layer2-2; Layer2-3.

4. There are 3 exited Layer 3 profiles: Layer3-1; Layer3-2; Layer3-3.

5. There are 3 exited Device & OS profiles: DeviceOS-1; DeviceOS-2; DeviceOS-3.

6. There are 3 exited Application profiles: Application-1; Application-2; Application-3.

7. Create user role: Access Control - R and Wi-Fi Networks - R+C+E+D w/ (ALL Venues)

step.actions:
1. Login Tenant w/ Access Control - R w/ (ALL Venues) account.

2. (PSK)In Create Wi-Fi Network page > Settings > Show more settings > Network Control

3. Enable "Access Control"

4. Check "Access Control Policy" dropdwon list

5. Check if there is an Add button for "Access Control Policy"

6. Click "Select separate profiles"

7. Check if there is a "Save as AC Profile" button

8. Enable "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications"

9. Check the dropdwon list of "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications"

10. Check if there is an Add button for "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications"

11. Check if there is an Edit button for "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications"

12. Create a PSK WLAN with a "Access Control" policy

13. Go to Administration > Admin Logs
step.expectedresults:
Step 1: Access Control - R w/ (ALL Venues) can logged-in tenant without issue.

Step 2: Can show Network Control configuration.

Step 3: Can Enable "Access Control"

Step 4: There are 3 profiles

Step 5: There is NO Add button

Step 6: GUI will show "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications" policies

Step 7: There is NO "Save as AC Profile" button

Step 8: Can Enable "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications" policies

Step 9: There are 3 profiles for each policy

Step 10: There is NO Add button for each policy

Step 11: There is NO Edit button for each policy

Step 12: Can Create the WLAN

Step 13: There was 1 log about the account login, for example: "Admin rbac dog1306.dev, rbac@dog1306.dev logged into the cloud controller."

9. Check the dropdwon list of "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications"

10. Check if there is an Add button for "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications"

11. Check if there is an Edit button for "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications"

12. Apply WLAN-1 with a "Access Control" policy

13. Go to Administration > Admin Logs

2. There are 3 exited Access Control Set: ACS-1; ACS-2; ACS-3.

3. There are 3 exited Layer 2 profiles: Layer2-1; Layer2-2; Layer2-3.

4. There are 3 exited Layer 3 profiles: Layer3-1; Layer3-2; Layer3-3.

5. There are 3 exited Device & OS profiles: DeviceOS-1; DeviceOS-2; DeviceOS-3.

6. There are 3 exited Application profiles: Application-1; Application-2; Application-3.

7. There are 1 exited Captive Portal + Click-Through WLAN, WLAN-1.

8. Create user role: Access Control - R+D and Wi-Fi Networks - R+C+E+D w/ (ALL Venues)

step.actions:
1. Login Tenant w/ Access Control - R+D w/ (ALL Venues) account.

2. Edit WLAN-1, In Edit Wi-Fi Network page > More settings > Network Control

3. Enable "Access Control"

4. Check "Access Control Policy" dropdwon list

5. Check if there is an Add button for "Access Control Policy"

6. Click "Select separate profiles"

7. Check if there is a "Save as AC Profile" button

8. Enable "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications"

9. Check the dropdwon list of "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications"

10. Check if there is an Add button for "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications"

11. Check if there is an Edit button for "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications"

12. Apply WLAN-1 with a "Access Control" policy

13. Go to Administration > Admin Logs
step.expectedresults:
Step 1: Access Control - R+D w/ (ALL Venues) can logged-in tenant without issue.

Step 2: Can show Network Control configuration.

Step 3: Can Enable "Access Control"

Step 4: There are 3 profiles

Step 5: There is NO Add button

Step 6: GUI will show "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications" policies

Step 7: There is NO "Save as AC Profile" button

Step 8: Can Enable "Layer 2", "Layer 3", "Device & OS", "Applications" policies

Step 9: There are 3 profiles for each policy

Step 10: There is NO Add button for each policy

Step 11: There is NO Edit button for each policy

Step 12: Can apply the WLAN

Step 13: There was 1 log about the account login, for example: "Admin rbac dog1306.dev, rbac@dog1306.dev logged into the cloud controller."

testcase.name: LBS-R (ALL venues) NET Ctrl > Policies & Profiles >Location Based Service
testcase.summary:
(R) - Location Based Service List

(R) - Search Column

(R) - Network dorp down list

(X) - Edit

(X) - Delete

(X) - Add Location Based Service

(X) - LBS card in add profile page

(X) -Configure button in detail page
testcase.preconditions:
1. create 3 Venues: Venue-1; Venue-2; Venue-3

2. There are 3 exited Location Based Service: LBS-1(Venue-1); LBS-2(Venue-2); LBS-3(none).

3. Create user role: Custom LBS - R w/ (ALL Venues)

step.actions:
1. Login Tenant w/ Custom Custom LBS - R w/ (ALL Venues) account.

2. Go to Network Control > Policies & Profiles > Location Based Service

3. Check "Add LBS Server" button

4. Select the "LBS-1" Profile

5. Check if there is a search bar

6. Check if there is a Venues drop-down list

7.Go to Network Control > Policies & Profiles and Check "Add Policy or Profile" button.

8. Click "LBS-1" to enter detail page and check the "Configure" button.

9. Click "LBS-1" to enter detail page and check the "Instances" list.

10. Click "LBS-2" to enter detail page and check the "Instances" list.

11. Go to Administration > Admin Logs
step.expectedresults:
Step 1: Custom LBS - R w/ (ALL Venues) can logged-in tenant without issue.

Step 2: There are 3 created LBS profiles.

Step 3: There is NO "Add LBS Server" button

Step 4: There is NO Edit and Delete button

Step 5: There is a search bar

Step 6: There is a Venues drop-down list, and show 3 venues

Step 7: There is NO "Add Policy or Profile" button.

Step 8: There is NO "Configure" button.

Step 9: There is 1 venue, Venue-1.

Step 10: There is 1 venue, Venue-2.

Step 11: There was 1 log about the account login, for example: "Admin rbac dog1306.dev, rbac@dog1306.dev logged into the cloud controller."

12. Click "LBS-2" to enter detail page and check the "Instances" list.

VLANs: "101-102"

step.expectedresults: Login success

step.expectedresults: Go to VLAN Pools list page.

step.actions: Click VLAN pool profile e.g. "Pool101-102"
step.expectedresults: User can read VLAN pool profile content.

step.actions:
Back to  Network Control > Policies & Profiles

Check "Add Policy or Profile",
step.expectedresults: No "Add Policy or Profile" icon

step.actions: Go to Network Control > Policies & Profiles, Click VLAN Pools
step.expectedresults: Add VLAN Pool icon shall not be displayed.

step.actions: Go to Network Control> Policies & Profiles. Click VLAN  Pools and select one VLAN Pool profile.
step.expectedresults: Cannot select VLAN pool

step.actions: Go to Network Control> Policies & Profiles.  Click VLAN  Pools and select one VLAN Pool profile.
step.expectedresults: Cannot select VLAN Pool

testcase.name: (D) Ad-WiFi-vlan_pool(R)WiFi_network(RE)(All Venues)During editing (CP-AD)WLAN, add VLAN pool
testcase.preconditions:
1. Venue created (name: Venue1) in US country code, e.g. address: 350 W Java Dr, Sunnyvale, CA 94089, USA. 
2. User be assigned
    Advanced Permissions> WiFi > Network Control (Policies) > VLAN Pool (R),
    Advanced Permissions> WiFi > WiFi >WiFi Network (RE),
    User can access all venues.
 
3. Created VLAN Pools profile.
Policy Name : "Pool101-102"
VLANs: "101-102"
4. Created WLAN "_WLAN_001"

step.actions: Login ACX with account  e.g. User@gmail.com
step.expectedresults: Login success

step.actions:
Edit WiFi Network 

In "More Settings" page
Enable "VLAN pooling"
step.expectedresults:
There is no "Add Pool" icon.
 
"Pool101-102" shall be in the dropdown list.

step.actions: Select pool "Pool101-102"
Click "Apply"
step.expectedresults:
Relative Log shall be logged.

Relative Activative shall be logged.

testcase.name: Custom-NetControl-RCED (All Venues) Network control -> Policies & Profiles - SNMP Agent
testcase.summary:
(R) - SNMP Agent profile list

(R) - Search column

(R) - Venue drop down list

(O) - Edit

(O) - Delete

(O) - Add SNMP Agent
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create 3 Venues; Venue-1; Venue-2; Venue-3.

2. Join AP-1 to Venue-1.

3. Create 3 SNMP Agent profiles; profile-1 (Venue-1); profile-2 (Venue-2); profile-3 (Venue-3) from each Venue/Wi-Fi Configuration/Network Control/AP SNMP/SNMP profile.

4. create customized "Venue/Wi-Fi" & "Wi-Fi/Access Points" read & create & edit & "SNMP Agent" read & create & edit & delete privilege group account w/ (All Venues)

step.actions: customized read & create & edit & delete privilege group account to login Tenant.
step.expectedresults: 1. custom-read & create & edit & delete priviliege group account can logged-in tenant without issue.

step.actions: Go to Network control -> Policies & Profiles -SNMP Agent profile list
step.expectedresults: SNMP Agent profile list show 3 profiles.

step.actions: Validate the upper-right hand side shows the button of "Add SNMP Agent".
step.expectedresults: The UI shows the button of "Add SNMP Agent".

step.actions: Validate there is a search column.
step.expectedresults: The page shows one search column.

step.actions: Validate the Venue drop down list, shows 3 Venues.
step.expectedresults: The page show 3 venues in the drop down list.

step.actions: Upper banner shows command - "Edit" & "Delete" when single-select profile-1.
step.expectedresults: There are two commands - "Edit" & "Delete" on the upper banner when single-select profile-1.

step.actions:
1. Validate the "Add" button beside the column of Venue-1/Wi-Fi Configuration/Network Control/AP SNMP/SNMP profile.

2. Validate the "Add" button beside the column of AP-1/Network Control/AP SNMP/SNMP profile.
step.expectedresults: There are "Add" button beside the columns.

testcase.name: Verify Add Rogue AP Detection Policy Profile Link with No Create Permissions (Select venues)
testcase.preconditions:
Warning

Due to the "Service Catalog Updated Orientation" feature (which combines Services and Policies), adding a profile now requires navigating to "My Services" > "Add" and selecting a service from the cards, or accessing the Service Catalog and adding from a service card.

 

* User does not have Rogue AP Detection Create permissions.
* The Venues scope is Select venues.

step.actions:
1. **Navigate to Network Control > Policies & Profiles > Rogue AP Detection Page**
* Action: Access the rogue ap detection page.
step.expectedresults: * Expected Result: The Rogue AP Detection page is displayed.

step.actions:
2. **Verify Lack of Add Rogue AP Detection Policy Button**
* Action: Try to click on it.
step.expectedresults: * Expected Result: There is no "Add Rogue AP Detection Policy" button available.
